messages.subject: Re: Alabama Unschoolers?
messages.msgSnippet: Hey Tracy, Leslie - When I went to Live and Learn last year, I actually found out there were two other moms from Alabama, but none from Mississippi.  I looked
messages.messageBody:
Hey Tracy,

Leslie - When I went to Live and Learn last year, I actually found
out there were two other moms from Alabama, but none from
Mississippi. I looked because I live close to the MS/AL border and
love going camping along Hwy. 45.

Anyway, I'm having lunch in Birmingham with two other radical
unschooling moms Sat. Plans are still not set, but maybe you could
meet us there. And I'm saying that here, so if anyone else is out
there and wants to drive to Birmingham Sat. the 9th, email me off-
list so I can tell you what restaurant when we figure it out!

Deirdre

--- In unschoolingbasics@yahoogroups.com, Leslie <lesliel23@...>
wrote:
>
> Hey Tracy,
>
> Sorry I am just now replying to this, but we just got back from
vacation! I live in Alabama, but we live closer to B'ham. My dd is
12yro and although we've homeschooled for about 2 1/2 yrs now, we
just started unschooling in April. There is also an Alabama
Unschooler yahoo group, but not a lot goes on there (nothing like
this group!). We just got back from the Rethinking Education
Conference in Texas and we were the ONLY family from AL! We wanted
to go to the Live and Learn conference too but our schedule didn't
permit this year, but next year we want to do both conferences AND
send our dd to Not Back To School Camp. I hope we have the money for
all of it. I hope you can connect with other unschoolers in your
area, we don't know any other unschoolers and I thought the
conference was great b/c we could be with other freedom loving
families! It's hard to establish a support system when you're the
only ones you know that do what you do!
>
> Best Wishes!
> Leslie
>
>
>
> ---------------------------------
> Get your email and more, right on the new Yahoo.com
>
> [Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
>

messages.messageBody:
Hey Tracy,

Leslie - When I went to Live and Learn last year, I actually found out there were two other moms from Alabama, but none from Mississippi. I looked because I live close to the MS/AL border and love going camping along Hwy. 45.

Anyway, I'm having lunch in Birmingham with two other radical unschooling moms Sat. Plans are still not set, but maybe you could meet us there. And I'm saying that here, so if anyone else is out there and wants to drive to Birmingham Sat. the 9th, email me off-list so I can tell you what restaurant when we figure it out!

Deirdre


Leslie wrote:

Sorry I am just now replying to this, but we just got back from vacation! I live in Alabama, but we live closer to B'ham. My dd is 12yro and although we've homeschooled for about 2 1/2 yrs now, we just started unschooling in April. There is also an Alabama Unschooler yahoo group, but not a lot goes on there (nothing like this group!). We just got back from the Rethinking Education Conference in Texas and we were the ONLY family from AL! We wanted to go to the Live and Learn conference too but our schedule didn't permit this year, but next year we want to do both conferences AND send our dd to Not Back To School Camp. I hope we have the money for all of it. I hope you can connect with other unschoolers in your area, we don't know any other unschoolers and I thought the conference was great b/c we could be with other freedom loving families! It's hard to establish a support system when you're the only ones you know that do what you do!

Best Wishes!
Leslie

messages.subject: Re: Alabama Unschoolers?
messages.msgSnippet: Hey Tracy, Sorry I am just now replying to this, but we just got back from vacation! I live in Alabama, but we live closer to B ham. My dd is 12yro and
messages.messageBody:
Hey Tracy,

Sorry I am just now replying to this, but we just got back from vacation! I live in Alabama, but we live closer to B'ham. My dd is 12yro and although we've homeschooled for about 2 1/2 yrs now, we just started unschooling in April. There is also an Alabama Unschooler yahoo group, but not a lot goes on there (nothing like this group!). We just got back from the Rethinking Education Conference in Texas and we were the ONLY family from AL! We wanted to go to the Live and Learn conference too but our schedule didn't permit this year, but next year we want to do both conferences AND send our dd to Not Back To School Camp. I hope we have the money for all of it. I hope you can connect with other unschoolers in your area, we don't know any other unschoolers and I thought the conference was great b/c we could be with other freedom loving families! It's hard to establish a support system when you're the only ones you know that do what you do!

Best Wishes!
Leslie

messages.subject: Re: Alabama Unschoolers? Michelle

messages.messageBody:
Hi Michelle,

Thanks for the info! I don't know my way around Pensacola, so I will
probably need directions. :) I joined the group you suggested. Hope to
meet you all soon.

~Tracy

messages.subject: Re: [unschoolingbasics] Alabama Unschoolers?
messages.msgSnippet: ... Tracy, as Ren said you might want to consider heading over to P cola on Wednesdays for our LIFE group.  There are a few of us unschoolers still holding out
messages.messageBody:
On 9/1/06, Tracy <rosehavencottage@...> wrote:
> Hi Ladies,
>
> I was just wondering if there was anyone on the list who unschools in
> Alabama & if there is an unschooling group in the area. I live in
> south Alabama between Mobile & Pensacola, FL. Thanks!

Tracy, as Ren said you might want to consider heading over to P'cola
on Wednesdays for our LIFE group. There are a few of us unschoolers
still holding out amongst the group. Although it isn't all
unschoolers everyone is respectful. Lots of gentle parenting and child
lead interest activities. We meet Wednesday from 11-2 at the Bayview
Community Center (LMK if you need directions). If you go to the
website for the community center it actually says we meet on Tuesdays.
We've notified them of the error and they are trying to fix it. They
know we have met there for going on 5 years on Wednesdays so they
aren't sure why it says Tuesday. You can give me a call if you want
to talk or just get together. (474-0817) We are losing the community
center for 2 weeks starting the Wednesday after this one as they are
stripping the floors in the gym and it is quite toxic (which makes me
curious as to what they do with all the school children who are in
after school care?) We hopefully are either going to go to the
Environmental Center or the Silver Screen movie theater (for a tour
and movie and lunch). One week we are heading out to the beach as one
of our "seasonal" members has rents a condo out there each fall and
invites us over.

Hope to see you there. Oh if you want to check the group out we have
a yahoogroup called PensacolaLIFEHomeschool

--
Michelle
Michelle Leifur Reid
YOUR Pampered Chef Consultant
850-474-0817
http://www.pamperedchef.biz/michellelr
Check out my homeschool cooking classes!
